qas.question: When did Egyptians start to make red pigment?
What pigment was used for male skin tone in ancient wall art?
What root did Egyptians use to source their red pigment alizarin?
What type of palette was found in Tutankhamun's tomb?
What dye did the Egyptians make using the madder plant?

plausible_answers.text: "Oh Isis, protect me from all things evil and red."

qas.question: What did a prayer to God say in regard to the color red?
Who began manufacturing pigments in about 400 BC?
What color was widely used for wall paintings by ivory painters?
Who used the white alizarin to make crimson pigment?

context: But, like many colors, it also had a negative association, with heat, destruction and evil. A prayer to god Isis said: <b5_0>"Oh Isis, protect me from all things evil and red."<b5_0/> The <b6_0>ancient Egyptians<b6_0/> began manufacturing pigments in about <a0_0>4000 BC<a0_0/>. <a1_0><b7_0>Red ochre<b7_0/><a1_0/> was widely used as a pigment for wall paintings, particularly as the skin color of men. An <a3_0>ivory painter's palette<a3_0/> found inside the tomb of King Tutankhamun had small compartments with pigments of red ochre and five other colors. The <b8_0>Egyptians<b8_0/> used the root of <a2_0>the rubia<a2_0/>, or madder plant, to make a dye, later known as <a4_0>alizarin<a4_0/>, and also used it to color white power to use as a pigment, which became known as madder lake, alizarin or alizarin crimson.
